title: U.S. restores satellite imagery support to Ukraine amid ceasefire tensions
summary: The U.S. has reinstated satellite imagery support to Ukraine through the Global Enhanced GEOINT Delivery (GEGD) system, reversing a temporary suspension. The system aggregates data from commercial providers, including ICEYE, to aid Ukraine's intelligence-gathering efforts amid its conflict with Russia.
why_it_matters: The restoration of satellite imagery support underscores the strategic importance of commercial satellite data in modern warfare and U.S.-Ukraine relations, but does not constitute a direct corporate deal involving ICEYE.
